description:
Our computational challenges are so big, complex and unique we can't just purchase off-the-shelf hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Your team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Hardware Engineer, you design and build the systems that are the heart of the world's largest and most powerful computing infrastructure. You develop from the lowest levels of circuit design to large system design and see those systems all the way through to high volume manufacturing. Your work has the potential to shape the machinery that goes into our cutting-edge data centers affecting millions of Google users.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, more powerful, and seamless. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, our Hardware team is making people's lives better through technology.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in developing and shipping consumer electronics products or components.
  • Experience with mobile phone technologies such as power architecture, battery management, cameras, mobile SOCs, display, touch, audio, coprocessors, and other systems.
  • Experience with prototype bring-up and debugging, functional verification, and manufacturing support. Experience in creating system specification documents.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree in Electrical Engineering.
  • 10 years of experience with designing mobile phones or high-volume consumer electronics products with a track record of delivering high-volume products from beginning to end.
  • Proficiency with embedded systems, PCB systems, microprocessor integration, various communication protocols (e.g., USB, SPI, I2C, UART, UFS, PCIE, MIPI, DSI, DRAM), analog design, sensor design/integration, and low power design.
  • Demonstrated project management, planning, and organizational skills.
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to work on complex cross-disciplinary systems in a heterogeneous team environment.
responsibilities:
• Leverage fundamentals and industry experience to contribute to Pixel phone non form factor development hardware design and test. Lead a subset of power architecture, charging system, cameras (e.g., supplies, display and touch, audio, coprocessors), and other systems.
  • Partner with subject-matter-experts, and create module and system-level test plans for new devices. Drive and execute these plans in collaboration with external and vendor-based teams and compile the results into findings and next steps.
  • Demonstrate ownership at the system level. Work with stakeholders to deliver robust, production-worthy solutions.
  • Leverage consumer product experience to identify and root-cause potential issues for production and push to implement successful corrective action. Interface with adjacent teams to find solutions that meet their technical needs and the bounds of the product schedule.
  • Use analytical skills to review vendor-generated and Google-generated data to assess design robustness and identify system issues. Create models and analytical tools to project the impact of design decisions, production variance, and candidate changes.
title: Hardware Engineer, System Architecture
